nodes.bodyText:
I have mixed emotions about this change.
You've taken a set of small functions and combined their logic into one.  This is the opposite of the way good coding practice should have us moving.  Codeclimate correctly flags this by noting

The updateFunction method is Long (179 lines) which makes it difficult to understand
The updateFunction method has a large cognitive complexity (59) which exceeds  the 20 we have set in our configuration

But, I see that you're taking this from several places and putting it into one, and that generally is a good thing.
But I think we can do better, and here's how:
Change the f0..f28 variables in AbstractThrottle to be an array with 29 entries
re-write this method so it uses the array and constructs the property change values instead of using the constants.  (see the jmri.Throttle interface which defines them)
You'll also need to modify any throttle that extends AbstractThrottle and uses the f0..f28 values directly, which increase the footprint of this PR, but the code will be cleaner.  (These are protected values, so they aren't externally visible, except in the AbstractThrottle and it's decendents ).
Incidentally, if you want to get this merged in as is, I would be happy to take on the changes I suggest.
Thanks for the comments, I was contemplating an Enum for the functions but an Array much easier, please see update.
